abstractText: To ensure the accuracy ofeDNAresults, it is critical to avoid contamination of the field sample. Primary sources of contamination are anything that has come into contact with the targeted organisms, including water that may have been exposed to targeted DNA. In the field, sources of contamination include hands, clothes, waders, boats, vehicles, used sampling equipment, and the surrounding environment (Carimet al.2015).
title: Guidelines for environmental DNA field collection v1.0
